author: Staff Reporter
text:
A total of 167 candidates aspiring to contest the six assembly constituencies in Kanyakumari district were interviewed by the party observer Rajalinga Raja, TNCC executive committee member, here on Wednesday.

V. Asokan Solomon, president, DCC Kanyakumari West, told The Hindu that out of the 220 candidates expressed interest for contesting the elections, 167 were interviewed by Mr. Raja.

The incumbent MLA S. Vijayatharini seeks to contest from Vilavancode constituency and Colachel MLA J.G. Prince sought Colachel and Vilavancode constituencies. DCC, Kanyakumari West President V. Asokan Solomon has shown interest to contest in Killiyoor and V. Kannattuvilai Paliah sought Colachel constituency.

Magin, Nagercoil town secretary, sought ticket to contest from Nagercoil constituency.
title: “Congress interviewed 167 candidates in Kanyakumari district”
